official-title.#text: To authorize and request the President to award the Medal of Honor to Bennie G. Adkins and Donald P. Sloat of the United States Army for acts of valor during the Vietnam Conflict and to authorize the award of the Medal of Honor to certain other veterans who were previously recommended for award of the Medal of Honor.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives October 28, 2013.

header.#text: Authorization and request for award of Medal of Honor to Bennie G. Adkins for acts of valor during the Vietnam Conflict

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , or any other time limitation with respect to the awarding of certain medals to persons who served in the Armed Forces, the
is authorized and requested to award the Medal of Honor under
to Bennie G. Adkins of the United States Army for the acts of valor during the Vietnam Conflict described in

text.#text: Notwithstanding the time limitations specified in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: are the actions of then Sergeant First Class Bennie G. Adkins of the United States Army serving with Special Forces Detachment A–102 from March 9 to 12, 1966, during the Vietnam Conflict for which he was originally awarded the Distinguished Service Cross.

text.#text: The acts of valor referred to in

header.#text: Authorization and request for award of Medal of Honor to Donald P. Sloat for acts of valor during the Vietnam Conflict

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , or any other time limitation with respect to the awarding of certain medals to persons who served in the Armed Forces, the
is authorized and requested to award the Medal of Honor under
to Donald P. Sloat of the United States Army for the acts of valor during the Vietnam Conflict described in

text.#text: Notwithstanding the time limitations specified in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: are the actions of then Specialist Four Donald P. Sloat of the United States Army serving with 3rd Platoon, Delta Company, 2nd Battalion, 1st Infantry, 196th Light Infantry Brigade, Americal Division on January 17, 1970, during the Vietnam Conflict.

text.#text: The acts of valor referred to in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 552(e) of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2002
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2002/s:552/ss:e

header.#text: Authorization for award of Medal of Honor to former members of the Armed Forces previously recommended for award of the Medal of Honor

text.#text: by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , a Medal of Honor may be awarded to a veteran of the Armed Forces who, although not a Jewish-American war veteran or Hispanic-American war veteran described in
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2002/s:552/ss:e/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , was identified during the review of service records conducted under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2002/s:552/ss:b
National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2002/s:552/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: submitted, before January 1, 2014, a recommendation to the
that the President award the Medal of Honor to that veteran.

text.#text: In addition to the authority provided by

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 3304 EH: To authorize and request the President to award the Medal of Honor to Bennie G. Adkins and Donald P. Sloat of the United States Army for acts of valor during the Vietnam Conflict and to authorize the award of the Medal of Honor to certain other veterans who were previously recommended for award of the Medal of Honor.
